concept.shortdesc: The () provides a secure method of initializing and administering cryptographic coprocessors.

conbody.p: It is an optional feature, but it is mandatory if and are not available on your system. Initialization of the coprocessor can be done through for both the and environments, either with or without . Also, you can use the workstation to load DES master keys, PKA master keys, and operational keys in a secure way.
For information on which version is required for managing which , read topic .

You can load keys remotely and for multiple coprocessors, which can be in a single machine or in multiple machines. The workstation eases the administration for using one coprocessor as a production machine and as a test machine at the same time, while maintaining security and reliability.
The workstation can be used for enabling and disabling access control points for verbs executed on the cryptographic coprocessor. See for additional information.
